newsitem.title: SPAIN: Telefonica share offer has retail discount - sources.
newsitem.headline: Telefonica share offer has retail discount - sources.

text.p: The sale of the Spanish government's 21 percent stake in Telefonica early next year will offer a four percent discount for retail investors as well as a "loyalty bonus", market sources told Reuters on Wednesday.
The bonus would mean one free share would be given for every 20 initially bought at the placement and not sold subsequently for a full year, the sources said.
The placement, for which the calendar should be finalised and approved by the government this week, will be sixty percent aimed at small shareholders, they added.
Confirmed lead managers for the sale are Banco Bilbao Vizcaya, Argentaria, La Caixa and Morgan Stanley.
According to the initial placement calendar, an agressive publicity campaign should start on January 10 so that the book-building period can begin on January 13.
The placement should be over by February 10, the sources said.
Apart from the discount and fidelity bonus, buyers of the share offering will also receive a gift and can participate in a competition to win holidays in the Caribbean.
